posts.author: Bloodedblade
posts.content: Kicking around a weapon master but can't decide on what to do. I like using a two handed weapon for the damage but your ac just takes a beating. I'm open to a sword and board type build as well. Any help would be appreciated. Server tops out at 30 and +5 magical items can be had but very rare +4 is more common. Thanks abunch in advance.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey, man.

This is generally not such a good way of asking for a build. You just said you want a lvl 30 Weapon Master. There are SO MANY possible combos with this that you must narrow it down a bit for us to even start thinking about it.

I have a Paladin / Weapon Master which could be reworked for level 30, there are abundant Fighter / Weapon Masters, Ranger / Weapon Masters, etc..

Is there anything else you're aiming for? Do you want a toon that can buff or do you want a strainghtforward attack crit kill build? I presume a STR build is what you're going for. Do you want as many WM levels as possible or do you want only 7 for the extra crit range? Is Devcrit possible in the mix or is it banned?

Please, give us some more information on the kind of character you want so we can help you with the design.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Bloodedblade
posts.content: My apologies for being vague in the asking. I really appreciate you taking the time in helping. I usually play human for race. I was leaning towards the strength build for the crit feats. I lean towards the Great sword or if the AC is so bad not beyond a bastard sword and shield aspect either always had a soft spot for the bastard. I know there are probably better weapons in that regard for crit range however. Fighter / Weapon Master seems the most logical to get the feats needed with a good AB. I'm not sure what else to sprinkle with it to try and help the armor class maybe some rogue for tumble or even umd. I can't see any reason to take more then seven lvls of wm so it leaves a fair amount open. Devcrit has been changed from the fort save or die to causing blindness, deafness and silence for so many turns depending on the weapon base crit range still useful I would say. I hope this gives you the information that is needed. Once again my thanks for the help.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, generally speaking, WM 7 builds tend to be weaker than others that invest in more WM levels.

I am a bit tired of the same cookie-cutter Ftr / WM / Rogue build, so I'll suggest something different instead:

How about a Monk / Fighter / WM dual-wielding Kamas?

You can go Dex or Str and it should be an interesting concept. Monk 6 Fighter 8 WM 16 sounds good, with Fighter 6 / Monk 4 / WM 10 pre-epic. You can start with Monk for more skill points, then take Fighter feats later on. It'd be nice as an Elf because of the dual-wielding requirement. Let me sketch something up here and I will get back to you.

Take it EZ!

It should be pretty decent, however, AC is very low as is the case with STR-based Monks. If you want more AC, you need to go DEX and get rid of Improved Critical for Weapon Finesse (or go Human and rearrange your starting stats, which also gets rid of the XP penalty). AC then becomes higher, damage becomes lower. With 10 attacks per round it's really your call. No UMD means you'll only do damage against monsters with DR (Damage Reduction) if you're buffed by someone else or if you're STR-based, but that is server specific, and you know the server better than I.

One last thing, you can swap 2 Great Strengths and lose 1 AB and 1 Damage for ESF: Discipline (to remain upright if there is no KD immunity) and Armor Skin. If you go DEX, consider swapping Epic Prowess for Armor Skin at lvl 30.

Take it EZ!
